image.altText: Firefighters having lunch under a pall of smoke.

props.synopsis: Warnings are in effect for Boxing Day fire conditions that could be the worst Victorians have experienced since Black Summer.

title.children: As you sit down for Christmas lunch, these firefighters are gearing up

image.altText: A black and white photo of John Stonehouse on a couch with his wife. HIs two children lean over the back of the head rest.

props.synopsis: John Stonehouse was on a business trip in the United States when he vanished after going for an afternoon dip in the Atlantic Ocean. He was presumed dead until police found him alive and well in Melbourne, Australia on Christmas Eve.

title.children: After vanishing during an ocean dip, this UK MP assumed a new identity

image.altText: Donald Trump points as he stands in front of a gold-gilded wall and an American flag.

props.synopsis: Since pledging to make America the "crypto capital of the planet", Trump's promises to enact pro-cryptocurrency policies have helped push the value of bitcoin to new records. Can the great run continue?

title.children: Trump's plans for bitcoin strategic reserve are either 'crazy' or 'something great'

image.altText: A screenshot of a video showing a man with mud on his face.

props.synopsis: This week, a hostage video emerged of captured soldier and Australian man Oscar Jenkins being detained and interrogated by Russian forces in eastern Ukraine.

title.children: Australian man Oscar Jenkins has been captured by Russia. What happens now?

image.altText: Two women sailing a yacht out at sea, with one taking the selfie while the other steers in the background.

props.synopsis: For almost all of the crews in this year's Sydney to Hobart yacht race, the 628-nautical mile bluewater classic is their "grand final" — but for Annette Hesselmans and her daughter, Sophie Snijders, aboard Fika, it's just the qualifier for the Melbourne to Osaka marine marathon.

title.children: First stop Hobart, next up Osaka for Annette and Sophie

image.altText: People wearing Santa Claus outfits pose for media

props.synopsis: It's not even a public holiday in Japan, but Christmas is big business. How did it become such a popular occasion?

title.children: Christmas in Japan is all about cake, dating and KFC. Here's why

image.altText: sign lit up of BYD

props.synopsis: More than 160 Chinese nationals working in "slave-like conditions" to build a factory for BYD have been found in Brazil, according to local authorities.

title.children: Chinese EV company factory construction shut down over alleged forced labour

image.altText: a search Marine Rescue NSW Volunteer on a boat on the water searching for a missing swimmer

props.synopsis: Emergency services were called to North Avoca Beach about 3pm on Tuesday following reports a 15-year-old boy was missing in the water.

title.children: Search resumes for teen believed swept off rocks at Central Coast beach

image.altText: A smiling blonde woman holding ski goggles above her eyes.

props.synopsis: Sophie Hediger, 26, was caught up in an avalanche in Arosa, according to the Swiss-Ski federation.

title.children: Swiss snowboarding Olympian Sophie Hediger dies in avalanche

image.altText: A sign reading 'beyond this point nudity is permitted'.

props.synopsis: The country's first legal nude beach got many people's knickers in a knot. But do modern-day naturists even want to reveal all by the water anymore?

title.children: How the younger generations are redefining nude beaches

image.altText: Australia's football superstar Sam Kerr looks sad but gives a thumbs up to the crowd after the Matildas Women's World Cup loss.

props.synopsis: Look back at the 2024 sporting year through some of your most read stories on ABC Sport.

title.children: Sam Kerr's arrest, Titmus breaks records and Raygun's baffling performance: Sport in 2024

image.altText: Peel Island view from tank stand

props.synopsis: For five decades people were forced to live on an island off the Queensland coast. They were not going there for treatment, but rather to be isolated after being diagnosed with leprosy.

title.children: 'I always used to feel sub-human': People forced to live on island after leprosy diagnosis

image.altText: Missing man Jack McLennan standing in gym uniform

props.synopsis: The mother of 27-year-old missing Queensland man Jack McLennan will spend Christmas looking for her son with a strategic shift since his disappearance in early October.

title.children: Search for Jack McLennan 'another day, another nightmare' at Christmas

image.altText: An elderly couple hold and look on at photos of the aftermath of Cyclone Tracy

props.synopsis: Retired policeman Terry Ey and his wife Rosemary took up a posting in Darwin just before Christmas in 1974. They reflect on the terror and aftermath of one of Australia's worst ever natural disasters.

title.children: Fifty years after Cyclone Tracy, a family remembers the eye of the storm

image.altText: Bluebottles along the shore at a beach.

props.synopsis: Scientists from UNSW Sydney are creating technology that can go so far as to predict which beaches and on what days bluebottles will wash ashore.

title.children: Scientists creating tool to predict when bluebottles will arrive

props.synopsis: Religious figures from across the country send Christmas wishes and messages of hope.

title.children: Religious leaders from across Australia deliver Christmas messages

image.altText: A crowd of people in front of a fire and plume of smoke.

props.synopsis: A Dutch court convicts five men for their part in last month's violence against Israeli football fans in Amsterdam that sparked accusations of anti-Semitism

title.children: Five men convicted over violence against Israelis in Amsterdam football match

image.altText: An Arab man with short hair, a beard and a black suit speaks into microphones looking serious

props.synopsis: New Syrian leader Ahmed al-Sharaa reaches an agreement with some rebel leaders to merge factions under the new administration.

title.children: Some Syrian rebel groups agree to dissolve and join new government

image.altText: Three planes with the American flag stripe sit at terminals at an airport during sunset

props.synopsis: The US transport authority lifts a ground stop on American Airlines flights after a system-wide technical issue was resolved.

title.children: American Airlines flights resume after nationwide grounding on Christmas Eve

image.altText: A woman holding a card

props.synopsis: Noela Hellyer will gather with family and friends today to celebrate her 100th birthday, with the focus on her this time rather than Christmas.

title.children: Noela to finally get birthday party of her own on 100th Christmas Day

image.altText: People look at Christmas trees and lights in the snow at night.

props.synopsis: The festive season in Australia coincides with the longest days of the year. But imagine living somewhere where you don't see sunlight at all and it lasts for four months.

title.children: What is Christmas like in the North Pole? Constant darkness and snow

image.altText: A group of masked men dressed entirely black stand on the steps of parliament with banners, one which says "Jews hate freedom".

props.synopsis: A Wantirna South man presented himself to a police station following an investigation into an anti-Semitic protest on the steps of Parliament House last Friday.

title.children: Melbourne man hands himself to police following anti-Semitic CBD rally

image.altText: A man with his face blurred wearing a red cap and pink t-shirt is arrested by a man in a suit in a street.

props.synopsis: NSW Police arrested Guy Norman Hartcher in Pendle Hill and charged the 77-year-old with use carriage service-procure under 16 years for sex with another and use carriage service to send indecent material to person under 16.

title.children: Sydney priest charged with allegedly grooming teenage boy

image.altText: Two young men in black polo shirts.

props.synopsis: Jeffrey Frank, 20, and Deacon Sawdy, 17, patrol the streets of Tennant Creek until 4am in their night bus, getting kids home safely and keeping them out of trouble.

title.children: Young men once in trouble with the law keep kids on track with night bus

image.altText: A man stands while wearing a pastel blue shirt and a black blazer.

props.synopsis: Justin Trudeau has suffered a series of blows in recent days, spurred by the surprise resignation of Deputy Prime Minister Chrystia Freeland, which marked the first open dissent against the prime minister from within his cabinet and has emboldened critics.

title.children: Canadian PM Trudeau in fight of his political life after party revolt

image.altText: Parishioners inside a Catholic cathedral after mass.

props.synopsis: Two churches in regional NSW damaged by natural disasters have reopened in time for Christmas.

title.children: Century-old church restored after year-long project to repair tornado damage

image.altText: Two fairy terns with one holding some fish

props.synopsis: Conservationists say a threatened fairy tern population at a nesting site in WA's South West has been "almost wiped out" halfway through breeding season.

title.children: Threatened bird species' nesting site devastated in WA's South West

image.altText: Sam Konstas smiles while speaking to media at an Australian training session

props.synopsis: Teenage opener Sam Konstas will become one of Australia's youngest Test cricketers after being named to make his debut at the MCG on Boxing Day.

title.children: Sam Konstas to debut in Boxing Day Test, Travis Head battles calf strain

image.altText: A man wearing a black shirt and a traditional Tongan woven mat.

props.synopsis: Tonga's parliament elects former finance minister 'Aisake Eke as its new prime minister in a Christmas Eve sitting.

title.children: New Tongan prime minister elected in secret ballot after surprise resignation

image.altText: A woman in a blue dress accepts a figurine as men watch on

props.synopsis: Russia denies Turkish media reports suggesting the British-born wife of former Syrian president Basher al-Assad has filed for a divorce.

title.children: Kremlin rejects divorce claims about Asma al-Assad

image.altText: Donald Trump in front of a wall of American flags.

props.synopsis: Greenland tells Donald Trump the country is not for sale, responding to the US president-elect's comments about taking control of the territory.

title.children: Greenland says it is not for sale, after Trump suggests taking control

image.altText: Cadbury was first awarded a Royal Warrant in 1854.

props.synopsis: King Charles grants royal warrants to 386 companies that previously held warrants from the late Queen, including Weetabix, Heinz and Nestle. Here's what it means.

title.children: Why Cadbury was stripped of its royal seal of approval

props.synopsis: The first captive-born Maugean skate in the world turns one year old on Christmas Eve, in a milestone for the Tasmanian breeding program.

title.children: Captive-bred endangered skate celebrates first birthday with dog toy

image.altText: Food on a table for a Christmas meal.

props.synopsis: From meal preparation to the conversation over lunch, couples and relationships counsellor Kris Waller says a calm and fun Christmas Day starts with relinquishing any fantasies of perfection.

title.children: Relationship counsellor shares advice for an enjoyable Christmas Day
